method.name: ID3 Discretizer

reference.ref: J.R. Quinlan. Induction of Decision Trees. Machine Learning 1 (1986) 81-106.

generalDescription.objective: To transform a set of numerical variables into nominal variables. Input variables may be either real or integer.
generalDescription.howWork:
Id3 Discretizer is an algorithm that discretizes the non nominal attributes (real or integer) of a group of instances.
The task of a discretization algorithm is to build a set of intervals for each non nominal attribute. The value of the attribute is translated to the interval number to which the value belongs.
ID3 Discretizer builds the intervals in a recursive way. The cutting point is chosen as the entropy is minimized. This process goes repeating in a recursive way until the interval doesn't allow more partitions.

method.example:
Problem type: Classification Method: Id3 Discretizer Dataset: Iris Plants
Input Training set: Iris-5x2-1tra.dat Input Test set: Iris-5x2-1tst.dat Output Training set: result0.tra Output Test set: result0.tst Descriptor: result0e0.txt
Parameters: default values
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the experiment/results/Disc-ID3/iris folder the discretization results; 3 files are generated in this folder:
File result0.tra: It contains the discretization result of training set.
